intro: Echinopepon milleflorus, commonly known as the starfruit melon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Its fruit is characterized by a star-shaped appearance and a sweet, tangy flavor. The botanical features of Echinopepon milleflorus make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ornamental gardening.
